current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To require reports by Federal Government entities
		  regarding responses to Inspector General recommendations on potential
		  cost-saving measures or on reimbursement for poor contractor performance, cost
		  overruns, or other reasons, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Homeland Security and
			 Governmental Affairs

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

header.#text:
Reports by
			 Federal entities on responses to Inspector General recommendations on potential
			 cost-saving measures or reimbursement for poor contractor performance, cost
			 overruns, or other reasons

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Special Inspector General for Afghanistan
			 Reconstruction
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Special Inspector General for Afghanistan Reconstruction

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, or any
			 other Inspector General under applicable law, or 30 days after the
			 establishment responds to a covered audit report with a non-concur or partial
			 concur response, the head of the establishment shall submit to Congress a
			 report with an explanation for the failure to respond or the non-concur or
			 partial concur response.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Special Inspector General for Iraq Reconstruction
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Special Inspector General for Iraq Reconstruction

text.#text:
Not later
			 than 30 days after the end of the 60-day period for an audited establishment to
			 respond to a covered final audit report submitted to the establishment by an
			 Inspector General under

external-xref.#tail: of the Inspector General Act of 1978

header.#text:
Failures to
			 respond,Low-rankin non-concurs, and partial concurs

Special
			 Inspector General for Afghanistan Reconstruction
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Special Inspector General for Afghanistan Reconstruction

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, or any other Inspector General under applicable law,
			 with a full concur response, the head of the establishment shall submit to
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Special Inspector General
			 for Iraq Reconstruction
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Special Inspector General for Iraq Reconstruction

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report with a description of the status of any open or pending
			 recommendations from the Inspector General, including any actions taken to
			 implement the recommendations.

text.#text:
Not later than 180 days after an establishment responds
			 to a covered audit report submitted to the establishment by an Inspector
			 General under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or other applicable law that includes a recommendation for
			 an establishment to implement cost-saving measures or to seek reimbursement for
			 failure by a contractor or subcontractor to successfully complete a contract
			 due to poor contractor performance, cost-overruns, or other reasons that would,
			 if implemented, result in at least $2,000,000 in savings.

term.#tail: means a final audit report issued by an Inspector General under the

section 12
